Literature Review: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to significant changes in household behavior, with a focus on consumption, credit, and investments. This literature review aims to summarize the existing research on household behavior during the pandemic, highlighting the key findings and implications for policymakers.

References.title: Household Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Global Analysis
References.authors: Kilian, T. J., & Taylor, M. P.

References.title: The COVID-19 Pandemic and Household Consumption: A Cross-Country Analysis
Government Stimulus and Household Consumption: Evidence from the COVID-19 Pandemic
References.journal: Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control

References.title: The Impact of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Household Credit: A Systematic Review
References.authors: Lee, S. H., & Lee, Y. S.

References.title: Household Investment Behavior during the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Survey of the Literature
